Therefore it was modified by the act of May 10, 1872, so as to provide for exceptional cases where reason and common sense required a different regulation. Such an exceptional case, in my judgment, is now before me, where the entire pl

refore, that the proviso attached to section 4 of the act of June 6, 1900, was a mere reiteration and adoption of the old Oregon statute, and it can have no possible meaning or effect as applied to conditions in Alaska at the time of the passage of the act of June 6, 1900. docket shows that the next step in the case occurred on November 2d, when the case was set for trial on November 5, 1900, at 10 a. m.; but again the record fails to show any appearance, trial, or postponement.
